data.title: Sir Richard de Cornwall Earl of Cornwall
data.text:
Notes for Sir Richard de Cornwall Earl of Cornwall

Brother of H.III. Had at least 5 legit sons but none had issue.

Paul Reed reports (Foundations (FMG) v. 2, No 6 of July 2008, p. 438) that he had an illegitimate son Richard and that “there are numerous entries in CFR and CIPM that substantiate this descent. Richard’s line goes:

Richard de Cornwall, natural son of Richard the earl [Strirnet says he m. Joan, dau of John, lord St Owen].

|

Geoffery de Cornwall (d. 1335) m. Margaret (she d. 1345), co-hr of Hugh de Mortimer of Burford, Salop.

|

Richard de Cornwall (d. 1343) m. Sibil de Bodrugan (d. 1349)

|

Sir Geoffrey de Cornwall (d. 1365) m. Cecily (d. 1369)

|

Sir Richard Cornwall (b. c. 1359, d. 1443) who m. Cecily, dau. of Roger de Seymour and Cecily de Beauchamp of Hatch, Som.

CP, III, 431, note (g) states that Richard was a natural son of Richard the earl and the ancestor of the Cornwalls of Burford.

Burford is, apparently, Richard’s Castle, Salop.

_____________________________________
